DOC.brief_summary: Asthma self-management is an effective way to improve the outcomes of patients with asthma. However, to be most effective these interventions should be targeted and designed toward a specific population or group. There is currently no asthma self-management intervention directed towards older adults. The hypothesis is that a 6-session asthma self-management intervention will improve the outcomes of older patients with asthma.
DOC.criteria: : Age over 65, physician diagnosed asthma, need for daily asthma control medication, access to a telephone. Smoking history greater than 40 pack years, current smoker, mental impairment that would preclude participation in the asthma self management program
